solution: The four angles shown, $150^{\circ},$ $90^{\circ},$ $x^{\circ},$ and $90^{\circ},$ form a complete rotation, a $360^{\circ}$ angle. Thus, $$150^{\circ}+90^{\circ}+x^{\circ}+90^{\circ}=360^{\circ},$$or $$x^{\circ}=360^{\circ}-150^{\circ}-90^{\circ}-90^{\circ}=\boxed{30}^{\circ}.$$
model_solution:
Notice that the small triangles are similar to the large triangle and to each other.
Each small triangle is an $m\angle$ of the large triangle. Because the large triangle and the two small triangles are similar, the angle measures of the large triangle and the small triangles are proportional. So, the ratio of the angle measure of a small triangle to the angle measure of the large triangle is the same as the ratio of the length of a side of a small triangle to the length of a side of the large triangle.
Since the two small triangles are congruent, the angle measures of the small triangles are equal. Therefore, each small triangle has an angle measure of $\frac{1}{4}$ of the angle measure of the large triangle.
steps: Notice that the small triangles are similar to the large triangle and to each other.

Each small triangle is an $m\angle$ of the large triangle. Because the large triangle and the two small triangles are similar, the angle measures of the large triangle and the small triangles are proportional. So, the ratio of the angle measure of a small triangle to the angle measure of the large triangle is the same as the ratio of the length of a side of a small triangle to the length of a side of the large triangle.

Since the two small triangles are congruent, the angle measures of the small triangles are equal. Therefore, each small triangle has an angle measure of $\frac{1}{4}$ of the angle measure of the large triangle.
full_steps: Notice that the small triangles are similar to the large triangle and to each other.

Each small triangle is an $m\angle$ of the large triangle. Because the large triangle and the two small triangles are similar, the angle measures of the large triangle and the small triangles are proportional. So, the ratio of the angle measure of a small triangle to the angle measure of the large triangle is the same as the ratio of the length of a side of a small triangle to the length of a side of the large triangle.

Since the two small triangles are congruent, the angle measures of the small triangles are equal. Therefore, each small triangle has an angle measure of $\frac{1}{4}$ of the angle measure of the large triangle.
